com.ptrstovka.calendarview2

Class CalendarView2

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • com.ptrstovka.calendarview2.CalendarView2
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class CalendarView2
extends android.view.ViewGroup

    This class is a calendar widget for displaying and selecting dates. The range of dates supported by this calendar is configurable. A user can selectRanges a date by taping on it and can page the calendar to a desired date.

    By default, the range of dates shown is from 200 years in the past to 200 years in the future. This can be extended or shortened by configuring the minimum and maximum dates.

    When selecting a date out of range, or when the range changes so the selection becomes outside, The date closest to the previous selection will become selected. This will also trigger the OnDateSelectedListener

    Note: if this view's size isn't divisible by 7, the contents will be centered inside such that the days in the calendar are equally square. For example, 600px isn't divisible by 7, so a tile size of 85 is choosen, making the calendar 595px wide. The extra 5px are distributed left and right to get to 600px.

    • Field Detail

      • INVALID_TILE_DIMENSION

        public static final int INVALID_TILE_DIMENSION
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SELECTION_MODE_NONE

        public static final int SELECTION_MODE_NONE
        Selection mode that disallows all selection. When changing to this mode, current selection will be cleared.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE

        public static final int SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE
        Selection mode that allows one selected date at one time. This is the default mode. When switching from SELECTION_MODE_MULTIPLE, this will selectRanges the same date as from getSelectedDate(), which should be the last selected date
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SELECTION_MODE_MULTIPLE

        public static final int SELECTION_MODE_MULTIPLE
        Selection mode which allows more than one selected date at one time.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SELECTION_MODE_RANGE

        public static final int SELECTION_MODE_RANGE
        Selection mode which allows selection of a range between two dates
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHOW_NONE

        public static final int SHOW_NONE
        Do not show any non-enabled dates
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHOW_OTHER_MONTHS

        public static final int SHOW_OTHER_MONTHS
        Show dates from the proceeding and successive months, in a disabled state. This flag also enables the SHOW_OUT_OF_RANGE flag to prevent odd blank areas.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHOW_OUT_OF_RANGE

        public static final int SHOW_OUT_OF_RANGE
        Show dates that are outside of the min-max range. This will only show days from the current month unless SHOW_OTHER_MONTHS is enabled.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHOW_DECORATED_DISABLED

        public static final int SHOW_DECORATED_DISABLED
        Show days that are individually disabled with decorators. This will only show dates in the current month and inside the minimum and maximum date range.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHOW_DEFAULTS

        public static final int SHOW_DEFAULTS
        The default flags for showing non-enabled dates. Currently only shows SHOW_DECORATED_DISABLED
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SHOW_ALL

        public static final int SHOW_ALL
        Show all the days
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VERTICAL

        public static final int VERTICAL
        Use this orientation to animate the title vertically
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • HORIZONTAL

        public static final int HORIZONTAL
        Use this orientation to animate the title horizontally
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_TILE_SIZE_DP

        public static final int DEFAULT_TILE_SIZE_DP
        Default tile size in DIPs. This is used in cases where there is no tile size specificed and the view is set to WRAP_CONTENT
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • setSelectionMode

        public void setSelectionMode(int mode)
        Change the selection mode of the calendar. The default mode is SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE
        Parameters:
        mode - the selection mode to change to. This must be one of SELECTION_MODE_NONE, SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE, SELECTION_MODE_RANGE or SELECTION_MODE_MULTIPLE. Unknown values will act as SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE
        See Also:
        getSelectionMode(), SELECTION_MODE_NONE, SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE, SELECTION_MODE_MULTIPLE, SELECTION_MODE_RANGE

      • goToPrevious

        public void goToPrevious()
        Go to previous month or week without using the button buttonPast. Should only go to previous if canGoBack() is true, meaning it's possible to go to the previous month or week.

      • goToNext

        public void goToNext()
        Go to next month or week without using the button buttonFuture. Should only go to next if canGoForward() is enabled, meaning it's possible to go to the next month or week.

      • getSelectionMode

        public int getSelectionMode()
        Get the current selection mode. The default mode is SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE
        Returns:
        the current selection mode
        See Also:
        setSelectionMode(int), SELECTION_MODE_NONE, SELECTION_MODE_SINGLE, SELECTION_MODE_MULTIPLE, SELECTION_MODE_RANGE

      • getTileSize

        @Deprecated
public int getTileSize()
        Deprecated. 
        Use getTileWidth() or getTileHeight() instead. This method is deprecated and will just return the largest of the two sizes.
        Returns:
        tile height or width, whichever is larger

      • setTileSize

        public void setTileSize(int size)
        Set the size of each tile that makes up the calendar. Each day is 1 tile, so the widget is 7 tiles wide and 7 or 8 tiles tall depending on the visibility of the topbar.
        Parameters:
        size - the new size for each tile in pixels

      • setShowOtherDates

        public void setShowOtherDates(int showOtherDates)
        The default value is SHOW_DEFAULTS, which currently is just SHOW_DECORATED_DISABLED. This means that the default visible days are of the current month, in the min-max range.
        Parameters:
        showOtherDates - flags for showing non-enabled dates
        See Also:
        SHOW_ALL, SHOW_NONE, SHOW_DEFAULTS, SHOW_OTHER_MONTHS, SHOW_OUT_OF_RANGE, SHOW_DECORATED_DISABLED

      • setAllowClickDaysOutsideCurrentMonth

        public void setAllowClickDaysOutsideCurrentMonth(boolean enabled)
        Allow the user to click on dates from other months that are not out of range. Go to next or previous month if a day outside the current month is clicked. The day still need to be enabled to be selected. Default value is true. Should be used with SHOW_OTHER_MONTHS.
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to allow the user to click on a day outside current month displayed

      • getFirstDayOfWeek

        public int getFirstDayOfWeek()
        Returns:

      • setDynamicHeightEnabled

        public void setDynamicHeightEnabled(boolean useDynamicHeight)
        By default, the calendar will take up all the space needed to show any month (6 rows). By enabling dynamic height, the view will change height dependant on the visible month.

        This means months that only need 5 or 4 rows to show the entire month will only take up that many rows, and will grow and shrink as necessary.

        Parameters:
        useDynamicHeight - true to have the view different heights based on the visible month

      • isDynamicHeightEnabled

        public boolean isDynamicHeightEnabled()
        Returns:
        the dynamic height state - true if enabled.
